comments:
This is not very serious bug. However...
Create new Java project, open project properties, select BeanInfo Path. Error
message box comes up: Could not accept Changes: The currently displayed page
contains invalide values.
This is RC4 (build 24-06). See call trace below:

Alex,

the problem is inside

org.eclipse.jem.internal.beaninfo.ui.BeaninfosPropertyPage.createWithJava

which accesses a internal class in JDT/UI which doesn't exist anymore.

I don't know who is providing the BeaninfosPropertyPage, but it is for sure not
a Eclipse Platform project.

Hoewever, JEM sound like VE.

Are you running 1.0.1 with Eclipse 3.1? 1.0.x is not compatible with Eclipse
3.1. To be compatible with Eclipse 3.1RC3 you need to use the VE I20050623 driver.

Probably, you are right. I just cannot check it now because I did it at my home
computer. I download and expanded Eclipse 3.1RC4, then opened Software
Updates->Find and Install and installed GEF, EMF and VE. That's it. What was the
version of VE, I will be able to answer you tonight would it still be interesting.
Yes, you are right. This is 1.0.1 VE. Sorry, I close this bug report as an invalide.
